keyMoments.title: Confrontation with Marines
keyMoments.description: The Sun Pirates encounter a Marine battleship led by Rear Admiral Kadar who demands the return of freed slaves. The crew engages in battle.
keyMoments.significance: First major confrontation with Marine forces after the Mary Geoise incident, establishing the Sun Pirates as wanted criminals.

keyMoments.title: Bounties Issued
keyMoments.description: Vice Admiral Kizaru issues bounties for the Sun Pirates, with Fisher Tiger at 230 million berries and Jinbe at 76 million berries.
keyMoments.significance: Officially establishes the Sun Pirates as major threats to the World Government.

keyMoments.title: Taking in Koala
keyMoments.description: The Sun Pirates are asked to escort a young human slave girl named Koala back to her hometown. Despite initial reluctance, they accept the responsibility.
keyMoments.significance: Tests the crew's principles and compassion, particularly challenging their views on humans.

keyMoments.title: Tiger Removes Koala's Slave Mark
keyMoments.description: Fisher Tiger brands Koala with the Sun Pirates symbol, removing her slave mark and declaring the crew's non-violent principles by throwing a gun overboard.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the crew's core values of liberation and compassion, even toward humans. The Sun Pirate mark symbolizes freedom from slavery.

allegianceHistory.note: Crew dedicated to freeing slaves and fighting discrimination against fish-men

crewSymbol.description: A stylized sun symbol used to cover the hoof brand of the Celestial Dragons on freed slaves
crewSymbol.significance: The sun represents freedom and a new beginning, covering the marks of slavery with a symbol of liberation

philosophy: Liberation and freedom over revenge. The Sun Pirates were formed to protect freed slaves and fight against discrimination, with Fisher Tiger advocating for non-violence despite personal trauma.

reveals.information: Bounties issued for crew members - Fisher Tiger (230 million) and Jinbe (76 million)
Tiger's declaration of non-violence and liberation over revenge, symbolized by throwing the gun overboard
